snippet: The new guidelines announced by Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. would make it harder for prosecutors to obtain calling records from telephone companies without giving news organizations notice.
abstract: Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr announces new guidelines that will significantly narrow circumstances under which journalists' records can be obtained; outlines changes that prevent Federal Bureau of Investigation from portraying a reporter as a co-conspirator in a criminal leak as a way to get around a legal bar on secret search warrants for reporting materials; revisions also make it harder for prosecutors to obtain a journalist's records from telephone companies without giving news organizations notice.
lead_paragraph: The new guidelines announced by Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. would make it harder for prosecutors to obtain calling records from telephone companies without giving news organizations notice.

headline.main: Holder Tightens Rules on Getting Reporters’ Data
headline.print_headline: Holder Tightens Rules on Getting Reporters’ Data
